bibl.title: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1951

div1.p: Rath hopes that the National Council for Historic Sites and Buildings will be able to help in Hench's efforts to memorialize Camp Lazear.

div1.head: Letter from Frederick L. Rath, Jr., to Philip Showalter Hench, November 21, 1951

Dear Dr. Hench:
div1.p:
Upon my return from a trip to New York City and on the
eve of another ten day trip, I have discovered awaiting me at
the office your recent letter. It is obvious to me that I can
not do justice to the long and thoughtful account that you have
given of the effort to save Building No. 1 at Camp Lazear. I
was fascinated by the story you present. Although I have been
in this field for some time, there are ramifications in this
particular project that are quite new and quite different.

I do not want to imply too much. I do want you to
know, however, that I hope that we shall be able to do some-
thing to aid your fine effort. In my absence, I am going to
call your letter and its attachments to the attention of General
U. S. Grant, 3rd, our President, and to several others who may
have concrete suggestions about the role that we can play in
order to assist you. Upon my return in December, I shall write
again in greater detail.
